meanings.definition: To adapt or adjust to a new situation or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to a different country, she had to readapt to the new culture and language.
meanings.sent2: It is important to readapt to changes in technology to stay relevant in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to readapt to the warm weather by wearing sunglasses and a sunhat.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon changing colors, he could readapt to any situation effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: She had to readapt to the fast-paced city life after living in a quiet village for years.

meanings.definition: To make suitable for a new use or purpose.
meanings.sent1: The old factory was readapted into a modern office space with open layouts and natural light.
meanings.sent2: They had to readapt the traditional recipe to accommodate the dietary restrictions of their guests.
meanings.sent3: The robot readapted the tools to perform a new task, impressing its creators.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity allowed her to readapt everyday items into beautiful works of art.
meanings.sent5: The architect readapted the historic building into a trendy restaurant while preserving its original charm.
